paper_abstract: We introduce a realizability semantics based on interactive learning for full second-order Heyting arithmetic with excluded middle and Skolem axioms over Sigma(0)(1)-formulas. Realizers are written in a classical version of Girard's System F and can be viewed as programs that learn by interacting with the environment. We show that the realizers of any Pi(0)(2)-formula represent terminating learning processes whose outcomes are numerical witnesses for the existential quantifier of the formula.
paper_title: Interactive Realizability for second-order Heyting arithmetic with EM1 and SK1
